Description: Nozzle fragment of a mould-made pottery lamp: rounded nozzle with an angular ridge along the top, ending in a semicircular splayed tip with small volutes at each side, between which is a small leaf. At the body end is an elongated palmette in relief. The shiny grey surface is either slipped or burnished. Reduced fine grey fabric with mica and occational white inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Town (Naukratis), Site 95 (Petrie), the terracotta workshop, at the eastern edge of the town
Curator's comments: Found with 'eastern Buchero fragments from Naukratis' label. Bailey suggests this is an eastern bucchero fabric lamp (Bailey 1977, 258).
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q555)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KD.031) (Phase 1)
